story:
Once upon a time, in a land far, far away, there was a kind and gentle king who ruled over a prosperous kingdom. The king had a young son named Prince Lucas, who was known throughout the land for his pure heart and love for all living things.

Prince Lucas loved to explore the woods that surrounded the castle, and he would often spend hours wandering through the trees, discovering new animals and plants. One day, while on one of his adventures, Prince Lucas stumbled upon a small, injured bird. Its wing was bent at a strange angle, and it was unable to fly.

Prince Lucas carefully picked up the bird and cradled it in his arms. He knew he had to find a way to help the bird, so he carried it back to the castle and sought out the kingdom's wise old healer.

The healer examined the bird and told Prince Lucas that it had a broken wing. She showed him how to carefully set the wing and bind it with bandages to help it heal.

Prince Lucas was overjoyed when the bird was able to fly again, and he decided to keep it as a pet. He named the bird Faith, and the two of them became inseparable.

Faith grew stronger each day, and she would often perch on Prince Lucas's shoulder as he went about his duties in the castle. The other castle residents admired Prince Lucas's kindness and compassion, and they looked up to him as a role model.

One day, while out for a walk in the woods, Prince Lucas and Faith were captured by a wicked sorcerer. The sorcerer was jealous of the prince's popularity and wanted to do away with him.

But Faith would not let her beloved prince be harmed. She pecked at the sorcerer's face, distracting him long enough for Prince Lucas to escape.

Prince Lucas ran back to the castle and gathered the kingdom's soldiers. Together, they marched back to the woods and defeated the sorcerer, freeing themselves and Prince Lucas from his evil clutches.

The kingdom rejoiced when they heard of Prince Lucas's bravery and Faith's loyalty. From that day on, the bond between Prince Lucas and Faith was even stronger, and they lived happily ever after in the prosperous kingdom.

And so, dear son, always remember to be kind and compassionate to all living things, just like Prince Lucas. And like Faith, never forget to have faith in yourself and your abilities to do good in the world.

Now, it's time to close your eyes and drift off to sleep, knowing that you are loved and cherished by your family. Good night, sweet prince.
